Description:
20 ACRE BUSH BLOCK WITH A TRAIN!
Set on the edge of the township, this treed block is the ideal place to build your rural home or getaway, yet not being too remote. The land comprises of two titles, the smaller one being zoned 'Township', which makes for a simpler process to get a building permit (STCA) and there are no overlays. There's a power line at the front, and blocks this size & zoning are a rarity and it even comes with a train carriage you could stay in. Climb on board the train; next stop Newbridge!

Description:
HOSPITAL PRECINCT BEAUTY
Located in the sought after Hospital precinct, with ease of access to public transport in both directions, this low maintenance corner unit is 1 of 4 freestanding on the allotment.
Offering 2 generously sized bedrooms with ceiling fans. Master with a walk in robe and en-suite, 2nd bedroom comprising a built in robe and situated next to the family bathroom.
Featuring an open plan kitchen, meals living area with a split system for heating & cooling, which flows out onto a beautiful large decked veranda that continues around to the front of the unit, overlooking the well established garden.
Situated at the front of the unit is a study with built in robe, perfect for the work/study from home individual, also with a great view of the gardens.
This fully fenced property has access from the rear of the garage directly into the laundry.
An appealing property which offers flexibility to suit professionals, downsizers, first homeowners or have as an investment as there is already an established tenant in place.

Description:
And... Action
Here is an affordable home or investment property in a location that will encourage your family or tenants to lead an active lifestyle. A lifestyle out enjoying all of the nearby infrastructure and recreational activities on offer.
The beautiful Jobs Gully Bushland Reserve divides Jobs Gully Road and Oswald Street and is where the suburbs of Eaglehawk and California Gully meet. Meggs Court sits between Bright Street and Truscott Avenue and the property is positioned at the end of the cul-de-sac. Bright Street Park and play space are accessible at the end of the Court and this also provides a "short cut" to the bus stops along Bright Street.
Eaglehawk Secondary College is only short walking distance from the property and it's only a short drive to nearby primary schools, Champions IGA, Bendigo District RSL, Neangar Park Golf Club and the Sandhurst Road Milk Bar. As well as many other attractions including Truscott Reserve and play space and Long Gully Splash Park. It's a ten minute drive to the Bendigo CBD and just five minutes to Eaglehawk which provides great access to Aldi and IGA supermarkets, shopping village, Star Cinema, restaurants, cafes, bakery, banks and the train station.
Such close access to Eaglehawk also provides you or your tenants with the health and wellness benefits of Peter Krenz Leisure Centre which offers a gym, pools, steam room and spa. You'll no doubt visit Lake Neangar often to enjoy the space and equipment for adventure and movement play, as well as the picnic and BBQ facilities. Many a day will also be happily spent in and around the Botanical Gardens, sports precinct, McKern Skate Park and along the Mulga Bill Bike Trail.
As well as this property offering an active lifestyle, it calls you to act quickly to secure it ahead of other buyers. Measuring approximately 713m2 it offers plenty of off street parking under carport areas, which double as space for outdoor undercover living, meals and entertaining. The shed provides plenty of space for a workshop in addition to storage and there are plenty of grassy areas behind gates for supervised play and to keep pets. The three bedroom home also provides you with the opportunity to value add. For example it would be smart to fit robes to bedrooms two and three and give the property some cosmetic modern updates and a touch of your style.
Appraised rental value available on request.

Description:
PEACE AND TRANQUILITY
What an amazing lifestyle! If you've been looking for room to move and space from your neighbours this wonderful property is for you. This is one of the
original McGlashans family farm house and now sits on 13 acres + a road reserve of 2 acres (fenced within the property boundary on a 76 year lease). Featuring an extremely well maintained timber home offering four bedrooms plus a study, lovely bright lounge, an amazing farm style kitchen, a charming bathroom. Built in wardrobes & cupboards provide ample storage. With verandah's on two sides and surrounded by enchanting gardens and BBQ area with an abundance of native birds. The vegetable garden and chook shed might let you indulge in your dreams of growing your own vegetables and a supply of your own fresh eggs. The old barn and shearing shed give you space to indulge in your hobbies and the 9mtr x 18mtr garage with concrete floor and power is every big boys dream. The three car carport is close to the house. A flood lit tennis court and adjoining cricket net will make sure you and your kids / grand kids are healthily occupied for hours. NBN is installed to the property. Great access to Kangaroo Flat and Bendigo and close to historic Maldon and Castlemaine.
This is not just a home it's a way of life !
Note: ALL ENQUIRY MUST INCLUDE A PHONE NUMBER
PHOTO ID REQUIRED AT INSPECTIONS

Description:
FULLY RENOVATED, MODERN INDUSTRIAL ENTERTAINER
Ideally positioned, walking distance to the CBD and all amenities, this property is adjacent the Quarry Hill Reserve and Ken Wust Oval and just one block from the Quarry Hill Golf Course. With Bendigos industrial estate within close proximity, this newly renovated home is also close to schools, La Trobe University and bushland tracks and trails.
Beautifully presented, the property offers a neat façade with a brand new, large deck running across the front of the home. The front door opens into an entry hall, and to one side are three spacious bedrooms, all with built-in robes and ceiling fans. A large family bathroom at the rear of the house services these rooms, and this space has been renovated with a stunning heated concrete bathtub, custom concrete vanity and timber detail. A separate powder room, and a laundry with ample storage are also at the rear of the home.
Also off the main entry hall is an open plan kitchen, living and dining room. The modern industrial style runs through this entire light-filled area with timber feature walls and a high-end, quality black kitchen. The kitchen enjoys concrete benchtops and splashback, soft-close cabinetry and integrated double fridge and integrated dishwasher. A sizeable walk-in pantry with custom cabinetry provides further storage.
Outdoors, a huge alfresco space is absolutely built for entertaining. With a full outdoor kitchen offering storage, bar fridge, wine fridge, sink and built-in BBQ this space also features a bar, solid fuel heating and a large wood fire pizza oven. A spacious carport provides great undercover parking or additional outdoor living space, and the large shed is perfectly set up to serve as a workshop as well as great storage. The remainder of the yard is level and set to lawn with built-in garden beds.
Additional features include:
Ducted evaporative cooling and ducted gas cooling
Fully renovated throughout with new flooring, new paint, new kitchen and bathroom and repainted roof
Modern quality kitchen appliances including integrated double fridge, integrated dishwasher, wall oven with separate grill and five-burner gas cooktop
Automated front gate offering secure vehicle access
Double carport
Shed (6m x 12m with concrete flooring, lights and power)
Water tank (5,000l)
With fantastic proximity to all amenities, this home is ideally located and the superb renovation ensures there is not a thing that needs doing. This property is perfect for a tradesperson requiring great off-street parking and shedding options. With a stunning renovation and a wonderful space for entertaining, this is an excellent opportunity to secure a property that is move-in ready in a popular locale for a great price.

Description:
FANTASTIC SCOPE ON A LARGE BLOCK
Sitting on a spacious allotment with established native trees in the front and rear yard, is this solid brick family home. Just down the road from all the amenities of Strathfieldsaye, including schools, childcare, eateries, medical practitioners, supermarkets and more, the property is positioned at the end of a quiet court.
Set back from the road, the home was built in the early 1980s and offers architectural detail from this era, including a high raked ceiling in the main lounge room, large bedrooms and exposed brick walls in the living areas. The front door opens in to the main lounge, with space and light at a premium. Further down the hallway is an open plan kitchen and dining room and both living areas feature brand new oversized tile flooring. The kitchen has been partially renovated with new cabinetry in a modern-country style, and new appliances.
Off the entry is a room that links directly to the master bedroom, and this space could serve as a parents retreat, home office, nursery or large dressing room. The master enjoys a ceiling fan, walk-in robe and brand new ensuite. Past the kitchen and dining room are four additional bedrooms. Three offer built-in robes and ceiling fans and all are generously proportioned. This area of the home also features a laundry with side access, a family bathroom, and separate toilet adjoining both bathroom and laundry.
Glass sliding doors on either side of the dining space open to the outdoors. To one side is a paved alfresco area and verandah, and to the other is a patio that runs along the side of the house. The garden is mainly set to lawn with a large shed that is accessible via double gates from the driveway. The fully fenced yard is peaceful and tranquil with native birds enjoying the varieties of eucalypts.
Additional features include:
Ducted evaporative cooling
Solid fuel heating in lounge
Ceiling fans throughout
Partially renovated with new flooring in the living, new ensuite and new cabinetry in the kitchen
New kitchen appliances including wall oven, separate grill, dishwasher and four-burner electric cooktop
Shed
Garden shed
Secure vehicle access from the front garden to the rear yard
Double carport
In a fantastic location, at the end of a quiet, established court just minutes to the amenities of Strathfieldsaye, this solid brick home offers so much possibility. Partially renovated ensuring it is more than livable, there is still huge potential with this property. Minor cosmetic alterations will allow a new owner to really create a fabulous family home in a tranquil locale on a spacious allotment.

Description:
Four Bedroom Home in Strathfieldsaye
Phone enquiry code for this property: 3029
What a pleasure to inspect, this 4 bedroom, 2 bath, 2 living and 1 study property . On entering the front leadlight door you are immediately drawn into the generous entry area which leads into an open plan living and dining. While having your breakfast or dinner you can enjoy the atmosphere of your very own private 2 x 3 mtr fish pond filled with waterlilies and other aquatic plants. Opposite the dining area is the spacious chefs size kitchen with gas hotplates, wall oven and dishwasher. You will be draw to this kitchen for its abundance of cupboards, walk in pantry and bench space for every possible appliance. Off the entry is the master bedroom with en suite and walk in robe. Attention has been paid to the beautifully painted cornice and ceiling roses along with the addition of picture rails throughout. Opposite the master is a room perfect for a home hairdresser/ beautician as it is situated near the front door with sliding doors for privacy to the rest of the house, this room could also be a home office / library as it connects to the 6900 x 6100 lounge room with grey box floor boards and access to the over sized double garage. This lounge room was previously used as a theatre room and piano room and wouuld easily fit a large billiards table.
Located at the back of the house is a hallway which supports 3 double sized bedrooms, which all have had queen sized beds in them at previous times, they all have built in robes with hanging and shelving space. The main bathroom is well appointed, containing a shower, bath and vanity along with a separate toilet. The laundry is located at the back of the house and contains a large laundry trough along with large built in cupboards for linen and storage.
The whole house has a lovely light filled warmth, with ducted heating and evaporative cooling in the main areas and a split system in the lounge area.
The living area opens onto a large outdoor patio area which boasts views of the amazing garden and a working IXL wood burning stove and gas BBQ. If you are a gardener you will appreciate the numerous dwarf fruit trees, some of which are espaliered, apples, pear, cherry, quince, mulberry, grapes, apricot, avocado and fig. These are all watered with an automatic sprinkler system and 3 large water tanks that hold an extra 9000 litres of rainwater. Located at the rear of the property is a 5 x 3mtr garden shed with provisions at the back to house a couple of chickens. The high colorbond fencing gives the backyard plenty of privacy for a growing family to play or room for a pet cat or dog to run and play.
COME AND INSPECT BY PRIVATE APPOINTMENT , IT WILL NOT DISAPPOINT OR LAST LONG ON THE MARKET.......
Phone enquiry code for this property: 3029

Description:
Renovator in Fine Company.
Packed full of potential for avid renovators, keen-eyed developers, first-time buyers or investors looking for a quick flip, this property can offer dividends on every front.
Situated at the top end of town, this Victorian-style cottage nestles comfortably among an eclectic mix of the finest period and contemporary homes. The prime position is a short walk to the hospital precinct, the CBD and everything in between.
Ripe for a renovation for personal or business use, the home offers more space than the facade indicates. It features three bedrooms or potential offices, a large central lounge, light filled kitchen and meals, large second living/fourth bedroom or potential boardroom, bathroom, laundry and a rear vestibule.
The kitchen and bathroom were updated some time ago and with the front verandah recently replaced, it is ready to rent or live-in as is.
Set behind a cute picket fence on approximately 572m², the property includes a side carport with personal access to the residence and a double garage.
Don't miss this rare opportunity to secure a property within this tightly-held locale and capitalise on its enormous future potential - call for an inspection today.
** COVID 19 **
This property is available to inspect by appointment only. To arrange your private viewing please contact the agent or our office on 03 5444 2526.
While attending an inspection, we request that all attendees show their ID and provide contact details before entering the property.

Description:
Character Home on 920m2 Block close to CBD
What a location!
Positioned only 2 km from Bendigo CBD and on a 930m2 block!
Properties like this are becoming rarer and highly sought-after.
This charming 1950's home retains much of its original features with room to extend and make this a substantial family home.
Comprising of a lovely wide entry hall and 2 good size bedrooms, both with built-in robes and ceiling fans.
The large lounge is positioned at the front of home with light filled windows.
The open plan timber kitchen has loads of cupboard space, gas cooktop, electric oven and dishwasher.
Towards the rear of the home is a 3 piece bathroom, separate toilet and huge laundry hub with storage.
Other features include high ceilings, original hardwood timber floors, gas wall furnace and evaporative cooling.
Outside is a fantastic large back yard with outdoor areas and a 6m x 9m shed with concrete floor, power, storage and a handy sink with plumbed in cold water tap.
Double carport, garden shed at the rear, plus the added bonus of a new roof on the home.
Whether you're wanting to turn this gem into a family home or sub-divide and invest in the future (STCA).....either way it's a winner!
Currently tenanted until December 2020.

Description:
BLUE RIBBON STRATHDALE LOCATION
In a location historically renowned as one of Strathdale's best streets, this residence with a peaceful garden entry is awaiting a new family.
Step from the front porch into a home filled with light and warmth.
Big North-facing windows flood light into every corner of the large, L-shaped lounge room and adjoining kitchen/meals and family areas.
The kitchen boasts loads of timber cabinetry including double pantry and appliance cupboards, dual fuel cooking and dishwasher.
Sleeping accommodation includes a roomy main bedroom at the rear with walk-in robe, large ensuite and a leafy outlook over the front garden with remaining bedrooms enjoying easy access to the main bathroom.
Internal temperature is maintained by ducted heating and cooling systems assisted by ceiling fans, a gas wall furnace in the kitchen/family room and external roller window shutters.
The easily-managed landscaping features established shade trees and some backyard bounty from the raised herb and vegetable gardens in the terraced rear garden.
Under the house, the oversized double garage with auto door has easy access to the back yard & provides ample car accommodation plus storage.
Handymen will be able to indulge their interests in the approx, 7m x 9m shed with power, concrete floor, plumbed-in sink and full ensuite bathroom. Sited at the end of a separate driveway.
It's an easy walk to the bus stop, local cafes, schools, LaTrobe University or Kennington and Strath Village shopping centres. On weekends enjoy the many walking and cycling paths in nearby Strathdale Community Park and the Greater Bendigo National Park.

Description:
HERITAGE BEAUTY IN TIGHTLY-HELD LOCALE
Just five minutes walk to the centre of the city, and only one block to the arts hub that is View Street, is this stunning heritage cottage. Solid brick and built in the 1880s, this character property offers an abundance of original detail inside and out and quality construction has endured through the decades. Close to schools, hospital, swimming pool and more, this charming and surprisingly spacious home is located in a tightly-held area known for its quality houses.
Sitting behind a picket fence and neat cottage garden, a bullnose verandah with wrought iron detail and stone paving runs along two sides creating a welcome exterior. Indoors, high ceilings and heritage features lead you into a main hallway. Three bedrooms, all generously proportioned, are positioned at the front of the house. Two have built-in robes and ceiling fans, and two feature fireplaces with stunning timber mantles. A family bathroom with timber detail services the bedrooms.
A spacious formal living and dining room retains many period features, and next door is a more modernised kitchen with ample storage and a cellar. At the rear of the house is a large second living space and steps from this room lead down to a door at the side of the home and to the double garage.
Timber and glass sliding doors open out from the family room to a large alfresco deck perfect for entertaining. Steps from the deck lead down to a brick paved courtyard and established plants surrounding this space offer privacy and a peaceful place to enjoy the outdoors. Under the house is extensive storage space, and a double garage.
Additional features include:
Split system heating and cooling
Ceiling fans throughout
Gas wall heater
Open fireplaces
Original heritage features including high ceilings; decorative cornice, architraves, corbels and ceiling roses; pressed metal dado boards; wide timber flooring; and stained-glass double sash windows
Kitchen appliances including dishwasher, double wall oven and five-burner gas cooktop
Excellent storage throughout including cellar and additional space under the house
Access to rear yard via side street
This quality heritage home is absolutely perfect for a buyer seeking a slice of history combined with all the benefits of city living. With an easy-care garden, ideal for entertaining, as well as good off-street parking and a spacious, family-friendly floorplan, the property also offers scope allowing any potential buyer the possibility to add further value.

Description:
WHEN LOCATION MATTERS
Located in one of Bendigo's premier suburbs, Kennington, this home is only minutes to shops, schools, La Trobe Uni, local bushland and the CBD is an approximate 7-minute drive away. In very good order throughout, the property is ideal for first home buyers, singles, couples, families, downsizers or investors.
Boasting three carpeted bedrooms, the main bedroom comes complete with a walk-through robe and an updated three-piece ensuite. The other two bedrooms have built in robes and share the second bathroom which has also been updated. The kitchen features stainless steel electric oven, gas cooktop, a good amount of cupboards and bench space, pantry and easy-care vinyl plank flooring. The adjacent dining space easily accommodates the family dining table and lounge is a great place to relax. There is a second spacious living space that has a sliding glass door that leads to the alfresco area. Ducted heating and cooling flow throughout for year-round comfort.
Stepping outside you will find the tiled undercover alfresco area, an ideal spot for a morning coffee or to enjoy a BBQ with family and friends, garden shed to store the gardening tools, established gardens and plenty of room for the kids or pets to play.
For the car accommodation there is a double carport with gates that provide access to the rear yard.
In conclusion, this is a very neat and tidy home on a good-sized block measuring approximately 712Sqms.
Currently tenanted until October 2020 so there is the option to collect a rental income until you are ready to move in or if you are an investor, the tenant would like to stay on if possible.
Call today to arrange an inspection.
OPEN FOR INSPECTIONS - Covid-19 compliance
- Names and full details will be recorded
- Observe social distancing
- Obey instructions from the estate agent
- Leave the property if requested by the estate agent
- Do not touch any surfaces or door handles unless the estate agent allows it
Please do not attend the inspection if you are unwell or exhibiting symptoms of Covid-19
If there is no more space or the property is at capacity, we will ask you to return to your vehicle and we will flag you when we have more space.
**You will be required to provide photo ID at all inspections. Due to current restrictions, anyone currently living in metropolitan Melbourne or Mitchell Shire will not be allowed access to any property until further notice.**

Description:
Luxurious and Elegant Living
This elegant modern style home is your family's slice of luxury living.
The G J Gardner built near-new home set in Epsom's Langley Drive beautifully combines the contemporary vibe with polished modern aesthetics and offers plenty of natural light, high end finishes and a warming colour palette throughout.
In its ideal location and being under five years old, take the hassle out of building and make the most of its eligibility of the First Home Owner's grants.
The large master suite invites comfort and practicality with its large walk-in robe, stunning ensuite with his and hers vanity and large inviting shower and separate toilet.
It's the family chef's dream gourmet kitchen boasting a large island breakfast bench, quality cabinetry, subway tiling, feature light pendants and a stylish walk-in pantry.
The open style living area overlooks the home's landscaped backyard and large covered entertaining area. Create indoor outdoor living with ease with the property's impressive large sliding doors, providing the ideal spot to entertain friends and family.
It's the ultimate kids' retreat with the remaining three bedrooms and master bathroom and laundry centred around the ideal kids' play space with direct access to the alfresco area.
A stunning front facade, 5m x 6m concreted shed, landscaped backyard with side access, new 5kw solar panel system and its ideal Epsom location being close to schools, shops, public transport or a short drive into the CBD, adds to the investment appeal of this elegant home.

Description:
Central Flora Hill Winner
A stunningly refurbished home offering a contemporary and stylish lifestyle - welcome home to 7 Margaret Cresent.
The quality and attention behind the property's modern makeover is evident the moment you step onto the neatly presented front yard. Inside boasts a sleek gourmet kitchen, light filled living spaces, grand master bedroom with walk-in robe and ensuite, and elegant bathrooms.
Team this with the property's sought-after central location - only 2kms to Bendigo CBD and close to walking tracks, La Trobe University, schools, kindergarten, day care, local shops and public transport - this is one ideal property investor.
Stepping inside, peer down the hallway and you'll discover the home's sleeping quarters, main bathroom and handy European laundry.
The master suite offers plenty of natural light, walk-in robe and a quality refurbished modern ensuite.
Modern tiling, deep freestanding bath tub and floating vanity make the main bathroom a standout.
The gourmet kitchen is sure to impress from its quality appliances, abundance of storage cabinetry, feature light pendants and sleek butler's pantry.
Stunning polished timber flooring, ornate features throughout, high ceilings, feature brick fireplace with mantle in the living, and heating and cooling adds to this property's appeal.
Step outside into your secure neat backyard and imagine entertaining friends and family with your undercover entertaining area and paved seating space overlooking the rest of the yard featuring a 6m x 4m concreted shed. Ideal in location and with its quality refurbishment 7 Margaret Cresent, Flora Hill is an impresser.

Description:
Leave The Car At Home!
Fortunately this property offers ample undercover parking, because you'll be leaving the car parked and walking everywhere you need to go. This amazingly well located home offers everything on your doorstep.
Featuring beautiful timber floors throughout this 3 bedroom home is sure to impress just as much with its floor plan as it is with its location. Living room offers ornate fire place and it light and bright with large north facing window. 3 great size bedrooms all with storage. A beautifully updated main bathroom, as well as a separate second toilet located in the large laundry.
Kitchen offers ample bench space & storage as well as gas cooktop and breakfast bar and looks out to the dedicated dining area.
The home features ducted heating and cooling throughout and while outdoors you will appreciate the private rear deck and low maintenance yard.
Sure to impress home owners and savvy investors alike. Contact Briohny to find out more today!

Description:
House, Self Contained Unit & 3 Sheds on 3.5Ac
It's always a pleasure to return to a property to see what past clients have created once they have renovated and put their stamp on a place. To say that what I saw when I recently returned to 54 Stoney Gum Lane was "pleasing" would be a total understatement. The place is utterly transformed! How lucky the property was to land in the hands of a skilled carpenter when it was last sold. It's only that a job opportunity interstate has arisen, that this family will part with the property so soon after the completion of the renovation works.
This provides you with an opportunity to secure this beautiful 3.5 acre property and enviable country lifestyle. Here you'll enjoy the convenience of being located just as short 5 minute drive to Kangaroo Flat and 10 minutes to central Bendigo. As well as the privacy, serenity and health and wellness benefits of this perfect position, adjacent to the Lockwood South State Forest.
The house has been redesigned to maximise enjoyment of the stunning natural environment here. For example the new stacking doors to the lounge and open plan dining area lets in birdsong, sunlight and warmth, refreshing breezes and leafy green views as you desire. The three bedrooms are generously big and there is now an abundance of storage with brilliant cabinetry in the laundry, fitted robes to bedroom two and three and a walk in robe to the main. While the kitchen provides a walk in pantry and heaps of clever cabinetry. The parquetry floor in the kitchen was a labour of love for the carpenter owner. The front north facing deck and rear verandah dress and finish the home perfectly. The modern neutral decor, brand new carpets, paint, window furnishings and lighting all emphasise the perfect homely feel here.
Extensive shedding includes a 6 x 9m shed, a 5.5 x 7m workshop with a 3 x 7m carport and a 3 x 5.5m storage shed.
Your young adult will love the self contained unit - though may never want to move out of home! It's very, very cool! With keypad entry, marble look tile floor, skylight and LED lighting, lounge area, kitchenette and bedroom space it's truly a home in itself! What appear to be extensive robes near the bed in fact are. Oh, except for the middle doors which lead into a private ensuite!
What a transformation!

Description:
SPECIAL TO SAY THE LEAST!
To say this brand new custom built Murray Wearne home is something special would not be doing it justice! Located in popular Maiden Gully amongst a cluster of newly built homes, the individually designed and only just completed master build comes completely fitted, finished and ready to move in with nothing to do. Showcasing modern architecture at its finest, including an incredible façade and street appeal, the home is the epitome of quality and style and is what ultimately elevates it a level above its competitors!
The home has been constructed to a very high specification and features many of the modern architectural trends and design features. Loads of luxury specifications and quality upgrades are evident to the discerning buyer as you explore the approx. 30 squares under roof. The floor plan has many notable design elements include insulated walls and ceilings, viridian smart glass (low e glazing) to windows, and polished concrete floors. Ducted reverse cycle refrigerated heating/cooling is zoned with wi-fi home automation control integrated to your smartphone, and touch panel interface for easy use. Other upgrades include stunning raked ceilings, high ceilings with square set cornice, stone bench tops to kitchen, quality fixtures and fittings, and blue tooth integrated automatic irrigation to all landscaping to name a few.
The dwelling has been positioned to utilise the span of the block to perfection. Inside, the floor plan is sparklingly clean and brand spanking new having never been occupied. There are four carpeted bedrooms in all, three located to one end of the home where the main three-piece bathroom, separate toilet and kids retreat service this area. The master suite located at the opposite end has walk in robe and luxurious ensuite featuring free standing bath, oversized shower and his and hers vanity. The main hub of the home is the open plan kitchen, meals and sizeable living (the biggest of three living spaces) area under a beautiful raked ceiling. The stunning kitchen is equipped for a chef, and boasts specs including loads of soft close cabinetry, stone bench tops, huge pantry, Bosch appliances including 2 x 600mm under bench ovens and induction cook top and dishwasher to name a few. In addition, there is a theatre room for the movie or sports buffs out there, a separate full sized study (or fifth bedroom), and a massive laundry with walk in linen cupboard to finish the internal layout.
Outside, the 680m2 corner allotment has been fully landscaped, with lush new turf and garden beds installed and ready to enjoy. Exposed aggregate concrete has been used to both the driveway and outdoor area, with the double garage having automated door and direct internal access to the home. The outdoor area is covered and spacious, and is the perfect spot to entertain. The yard is a good size for both kids and pets, and there is a perfect spot to install a pool if desired. There is side access for a caravan or trailer storage, water tank, and automated sprinklers to complete this turnkey product.
A truly magnificent home that will save you the hassle of building. Close by are Marist College, Maiden Gully Primary School, supermarket, and the CBD is only a few minutes drive to work. Something very special here that you could call your own. Call now to inspect
